definition: genuine and sincere (idiom)/wholehearted
really/truly/indeed/real/true/genuine
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
real/true/honest/really/solid/fruit/seed/definitely
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate

sentences.english: Whenever you say” I love you”, please say it honestly.
sentences.chinese: 無論何時說“我愛你”，請真心實意。

sentences.english: We genuinely want to engage in consultation.
sentences.chinese: 我們真心實意希望進行磋商。

sentences.english: I never feel that that fellow is really sincere; he's too mealy- mouthed.
sentences.chinese: 我從來沒感到那個傢伙是真心實意的，他太油滑了。

sentences.english: God will not let you miss him if you are that serious about seeking him.
sentences.chinese: 如果你真心實意的去尋找上帝，上帝不會讓你錯過他。

sentences.english: Mr Obama’s affection for the people of the sprawling archipelago seemed heartfelt.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬對羣島人民的感情也顯得真心實意。

sentences.english: The rich people honest, the brothers is sincere.
sentences.chinese: 富貴這人實誠，對兄弟是真心實意。

sentences.english: Whenever you say:I love you, please say honestly.
sentences.chinese: 無論何時說我愛你，請真心實意。

sentences.english: We genuinely want to know what others think,” Biden told leaders gathered in Vina del Mar, Chile, for the March 28 Progressive Governance Conference.
sentences.chinese: 我們真心實意希望知道別人在想什麼。

sentences.english: Then she became terrified, and turned back and repented right heartily of her sin.
sentences.chinese: 她驚恐萬分，立即轉身，真心實意地爲她的罪過懺悔。

definition: to bear grudges
to put oneself in sb else's shoes (idiom)
docile and obedient/all obedience
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to be loyal (to one's friends)/to value loyalty
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
fair and reasonable (idiom); sensible/standing to reason
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
angry words/sth said in the moment of anger
to look for trouble
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
